issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

This message was automatically generated.

Fixed the following in the latest patch:
* TestLeaseRecoveryStriped.runTest - checkDataLength should be the actual file length used for testing when safeLength is larger than the file (equals blockGroupSize)
* StripedFileTestUtil.checkData - checkData should not assume that in case of a zero length file no blocks have been created (in a write failure case zero length blocks should be present)

Unit test failure seems to be unrelated.

Thanks for the patch [~zvenczel]. The patch looks really good to me.

For TestLeaseRecoveryStriped, the file length is a fixed value {{int length = (stripesPerBlock - 1) * stripeSize;}} should this value be
 pre-computed and re-used ?

Thanks for taking the time and reviewing my patch [~msingh]!
I updated the patch keeping in mind your suggestion.
